newsitem.title: USA: Genentech sues Amgen over Neupogen.
newsitem.headline: Genentech sues Amgen over Neupogen.

text.p: Genentech Inc is suing Amgen Inc, charging Amgen's Neuopgen white blood cell-stimulating factor infringes on Genentech patents for cloned-gene expression methods.

The suit, which was filed last month, was disclosed Wednesday in an Amgen filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Amgen officials were not immediately available to comment on the charges.
The suit seeks unspecified damages and an injunction barring Amgen from further infringement.
Neupogen, widely used by cancer chemotherapy patients, is one of only two products Amgen has successfully commercialized so far.
In its third fiscal quarter, Amgen's Neupogen sales rose 12 percent to $259 million.
Genentech is in the process of developing a rival drug to boost white blood cell count.
A spokesman for Amgen said the company is confident it does not infringe on any patent Genentech holds.

Under U.S. patent law, companies that believe their patents have been violated have six years to file a lawsuit. Neupogen was launched in February of 1991, meaning Genentech had to file its claim before February of 1997.
